title: Cloud cost data providers
content:
On the Cloud Cost Data Providers page, you can configure the connections to various cloud providers such as Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) for Cloud Cost Reporting. Billing data retrieved from these cloud platforms is used to generate prebuilt Cloud Cost Reports and to support custom reporting in Operations Cloud.

You can configure multiple cost reporting integrations for AWS, Azure, and OCI. 

Billing data is collected periodically and stored in OPTIC Data Lake. Collections occur automatically and can also be triggered on demand.

Tasks

On the Cost Reporting Integrations page (Administration > Providers > Cloud Cost Data Providers), you can perform the following tasks.

View integrations

The configured cost reporting integrations are listed and the following information appears for each integration:

  • Last status - indicates whether billing data retrieval is currently running or has recently completed. The status values are:
    • Accessing: Accessing billing data
    • Collecting: Collecting billing data
    • Cleanup: Cleaning up data from the previous collection
    • Optimizing: Improving reporting database performance
    • Finalizing: Finalizing collection
    • Applying Rules: Applying billing rules to collected billing data
    • Failed/Success: Final status of the billing data retrieval
     The integration status can also indicate less common cases, such as a canceled billing data collection or pending cancellation. Cancellation takes effect upon completion of a batch of billing data. Batch sizes vary depending on the usage. Cancellation times thus vary and can take significant time (minutes or hours).
  • Total records - indicates the number of billing records fetched
  • Start time - indicates the time at which the billing data retrieval began
  • Elapsed time - indicates the duration of the last billing data retrieval

Configure cost reporting integrations

Click the Create Integration  icon and select the cloud provider for which you want to configure a cost reporting integration. For more information, see the cloud cost data integration steps for the corresponding cloud provider (AWS, Azure, OCI).

 If you are configuring a new AWS integration and you see that collection is in progress for an integration that existed before the upgrade, wait for the collection to complete. If the collection hasn't run at least once post upgrade, run the collection manually and wait for its successful completion. After this, you can configure a new integration. If you observe an issue with the collection, perform the troubleshooting mentioned here. After the troubleshooting, the historic data collection will resume automatically.

Refresh integrations

Click the Refresh icon   to refresh the list of integrations.

Delete integrations

Click the Delete Integration icon   to delete an integration. After you delete an integration, data may remain on the associated reports for a little while. If incorrect data still appears on reports after 24 hours, please contact the support team at Support and services.

Edit integration details

Click the Actions icon   and select Edit Connection or Edit Cloud Tags.

Start/Stop collection

Click the Actions icon  and Start Collection or Stop Collection to start or stop the cloud cost data collection.

Manage billing data retrieval

On the Cost Reporting Integrations page, click the integration for which you want to manage billing data retrieval. The Billing data retrieval history tab opens by default. 

From the Billing data retrieval history tab, you can perform the following tasks:

  • Refresh billing data retrieval history: Click the Refresh icon   to refresh billing data retrieval history.
  • Start collection: Click the Start Collection icon   to start collecting cloud cost data. Billing data is collected daily and you can trigger a collection on demand.
